column4: Hi ubuntu, I installed openjdk-6-jdk and when I type javac it says it is found in the package openjdk-6-jdk.
I did a 'find -name 'javac'' and it appears in /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk/bin/javac
or you can just change .bashrc yourself
add the lines i put above

bash: export: `/usr/lib/lightdm/lightdm:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games=JAVA_HOME/bin:/usr/lib/lightdm/lightdm:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games': not a valid identifier
bash: export: `=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk': not a valid identifier
bash: export: `=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk': not a valid identifier
Thanks. Is that the only way to add to $PATH?
to export it in the .bashrc? yes
now just open a new terminal window and type java
